page.title: 16Home Life
page.content: In the eightees,more married women go out to work. More possess freezers, microwave cookers, food processors or mixers and together with the "conven- ience" foods, e.g. frozen beefburgers, fish fingers, tinned food, these make for speedier production of meals. Also easily available are washing machines,tumble dryers and vacuum cleaners which reduce the time required for house work, More homes have colour televisions and video recorders and rely on these more for entertainment.These days a typical Saturday evening often consists of a hired video film and a take-away meal from a Chinese/Indian/fish/chip shop. Home computer games are most popular. "Second" cars are owned by more people,which means wives are more mobile and children easily taken to and from school by car.
